subject: Data
title: Nightingale's Rose Diagram
description: A quick, practical guide to Nightingale's Rose Diagram.

hook.text: Florence Nightingale needed to convince generals that bad hygiene killed more soldiers than enemy bullets.

buildup.text: She created polar area diagrams â€” wedge-shaped charts showing monthly death causes in vivid color.

discovery.text: The diagrams made it impossible to ignore: blue 'preventable disease' wedges dwarfed red 'combat' ones.

twist.text: Nightingale knew numbers alone wouldn't persuade. She designed charts specifically for non-experts.

climax.text: Parliament reformed military hospitals after seeing her charts. Visualization changed policy.

punchline.text: She weaponized data visualization to save lives.
